column3:
weak digest was introduced in 1.4.20, no?

https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2015q4/000382.html

On Mon, Mar 6, 2017 at 10:34 PM, Matt Corallo <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Two issues in travis: its gpg is too old to set --weak-digest and sort
> needs LC_ALL, not LANG. Also, this checks the Tree-SHA512 for the top
> commit always, and needs a contrib/trusted-sha512-r
OK, now it just checks if you're running gpg 2.0.X or 1.4.1X since those are the only reasonably-recent versions which do not have --weak-digest.
